src/client/queryInterface.js
App
description:
App is the core React component that describes our application interface.
Note how it is incredibly simple; it contains references to a {@link Header},
{@link Search}, {@link Results} and {@link Footer} component.
To see what is in the Search component (which is the most important),
follow the import reference seen above on line 3, and open the file
'./search/Search.js'.

description:
Search encompasses the entire search interface, including the "Filters"
that allow a user to easily select pre-populated football team data.
Again, follow CurrentQueryTerms to './CurrentQueryTerms.js' for a deeper
breakdown of the interface.

src/client/tweetAnalysis.js
mostFrequentWords
description: Given a list of Tweet objects, return a sorted list of the most frequent words in them

name: groupedCountWords
description: Given counted words, return a new list with counts broken down by word casing

name: mostFrequentUsers
description:
Given a list of Tweet objects, return a sorted list of the 10 most active users.
If there are more than 10 most active users that have more than 1 tweet then
include them as well along with their tweets.

name: categoriseByUser
description: Group a list of posts by their author.

name: countWords
description:
Given some list of tweets, create a dictionary of how often each word appears.
Removes matched https://t.co/~ URLs
Correctly matches @mentions and #hashtags
Punctuation (hyphens, commas, full stops) are counted as spaces.

name: wordCountToSortedList
description:
Converts some word count object to a list of word/count pairs,
sorted from most frequent to least.

unknown.tagValue: {Array} A sorted list of word/count pairs, e.g. [{'word': 'hello', 'count': 5}, ...]

return.description: A sorted list of word/count pairs, e.g. [{'word': 'hello', 'count': 5}, ...]

name: doesFeedHaveUsefulResults
description:
Give a feed of Tweets, decide if the feed is still relevant.
If a feed had less than 100 results, or more than 5 results are
over 10 minutes old, it is considered not relevant.

name: src/server/footballSearch.js
src/server/orientdb.js
insertClass
description:
Insert a new class into the database based on some properties.
It will not override existing classes.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the new class, like 'Tweet'

name: createClassProperties
description: Add the properties to the db class

name: insertClassesFromSchema
description: Update the database to have all the classes in a given schema.

name: generateDatabase
description:
Ensure a database exists in a working format, creating a new one if it does not.
After ensuring it exists, set up all classes on it.
Not guaranteed to succeed, please check the console for results.

name: src/server/server.js
src/server/tweetFinder.js
searchQuery
description:
Searches our database for Tweets and returns them.
If the returned results are not satisfactory (such
as not enough relevant results, or they are too old,)
then the Twitter API will be called directly.

name: potentiallySearchTwitter
description: May asynchronously search Twitter for new tweet results based on queries.

unknown.tagValue: {Promise.<T>} Either resolves immediately or a promise for searching Twitter

return.description: Either resolves immediately or a promise for searching Twitter

name: buildTwitterQuery
description:
Given some search terms with param types, convert it to Twitter API
friendly queries.

unknown.tagValue: {Array} Some Twitter API queries, like ["#arsenal OR @manchester"]

return.description: Some Twitter API queries, like ["#arsenal OR @manchester"]

name: unionTweets
description:
Given a list of resultLists, union all the Tweets together.
That is, given the following list of Tweet ids:
 [[1,2], [2, 3], [1, 4, 5]]
return
 [1,2,3,4,5]

params.name: allTweetResults
params.description: A list of Tweet result lists.

name: normaliseQueryTerm
description:
Make a query more search-friendly in our database.
Multiple term queries will receive quotes to preserve order
e.g. "Manchester United" won't return results for "united manchester"
Long single term queries will receive ~ for fuzzy matching

name: src/server/tweetFinder.spec.js
src/server/twitterSearch.js
buildTweetFromRaw
description: Convert some raw status from the Twitter API into a proper immutable Tweet object.

name: findLatitudeLongitude
description: Finds if Latitude/Longitude coordinates exist in raw tweet, otherwise return 0.0 for both

name: buildTweeterFromRaw
description: Convert some raw user from the Twitter API into a proper immutable Tweeter object.

params.name: Boolean
params.description:
to signify if the passed in rawTweeter is a mention object
or a full user object that has a profile_image_url_https

name: processRawRetweet
description: Given some raw status we know is a retweet, insert it and add a RETWEETED link.

params.name: rawRetweet
params.description: A raw status from the Twitter API

name: linkTweetToHashtags
description: Link a tweet to all of its hashtags

name: processRawOriginalTweet
description: Given a raw status we know is not a retweet, insert it and upsert the user.

params.name: rawTweet
params.description: A raw status from the Twitter API

name: linkTweetToLocation
description: Given a tweet, if it has a place upsert the place and link it to a country

params.name: tweet
params.description: A processed tweet to link to a place

params.name: rawTweet
params.description: A raw tweet's place property from the Twitter API

name: processTweet
description:
Given a raw tweet, extract information about the tweeter,
if it was a retweet, etc, and store all information in
the database.

params.name: rawTweet
params.description: The original status object from the Twitter API

name: searchAndSaveFromTwitter
description: Search the Twitter API for some query, saving and displaying the results.

name: stream
description: Connect to the Twitter Stream API for one minute, processing all results.

name: src/shared/data/databaseInsertActions.js
src/shared/data/databaseObjects.js
convertSchemaObjectToClass
description:
Given a schema object, as seen in ./databaseSchema.js, convert it into an object
for use in the BuilderDecorator.

name: generateBuilder
description: Given an object name in the databaseSchema, create a useful immutable Builder.

name: src/shared/data/databaseObjects.spec.js
src/shared/data/databaseSchema.js
src/shared/utilities.js
flattenObjectToArray
description: Converts an object of style {'a': {'b': c}, 'd': {'e': f}} to [{'b': c}, {'e': f}]

name: flattenImmutableObject
description:
Converts an immutable object (one with purely getter methods) to a plain key/value
object, by calling the functions and storing the result.

name: toggleArrayElement
description:
Checks if the element is in the array, if it is, then return a new array
with it removed else add it to the new array

params.name: any
params.description: primitive type that can be .indexOf(ed) from an array

name: newPromiseChain
description: Starts a new Promise chain, resolving immediately.

name: makeGetHeader
description: Generates the boilerplate headers for a JSON GET request

name: makePostHeader
description: Generates the boilerplate headers for a JSON POST request

unknown.tagValue: {{method: string, headers: {Accept: string, Content-Type: string}, body: *}}

params.name: body
params.description: The body of the request, e.g. {'query': 'liverpool'}

types: {method: string, headers: {Accept: string, Content-Type: string}, body: *}

name: fetchPost
description: Creates a JSON POST fetch promise with a given url and body

params.name: body
params.description: The body of the request, e.g. {'query': 'liverpool'}

name: createTwitterParamTypes
description: Creates the paramTypes for a Twitter specific search term.

unknown.tagValue: [{Object}] representing search terms with meta data

return.description: [{Object}] representing search terms with meta data

name: toggleParamType
description:
Returns a copy of the paramTypes with the name of the passed
in paramType toggled

unknown.tagValue: copy of paramtypes with the paramTypeToggleName paramType toggled

params.name: paramTypeToggleName
params.description: which is the paramType you want to toggle

return.description: copy of paramtypes with the paramTypeToggleName paramType toggled

name: throttleFunction
description:
Returns a decorated callback function, which will be called some time later.
However, if the returned function is called again before the callback
is activated, the timer will be reset.
This might be useful say when delaying running a search until 200ms after
the user has stopped typing.

name: range
description: Creates an array filled with numbers between the range [min, max)

params.name: step
params.description: Step between each number, must be positive.

name: getParamTypeIcon
description:
Returns a semantic icon name or character to represent seachParamTypes
eg. hashtag = #, mention = @

unknown.tagValue: char or string representing paramType (could be semantic icon class)

return.description: char or string representing paramType (could be semantic icon class)

name: getSemanticCountryFlagName
description: Transforms the football-data.org api's player nationalities to semantic flag icon class name

unknown.tagValue: string representing semantic flag icon class name

params.name: string
params.description: which represents football-data.org's a player's nationality

return.description: string representing semantic flag icon class name
